snippet: A mass killing has revealed new depths of ruthlessness in Syria’s conflict, inflaming sectarian divisions and making any hope of reconciliation appear ever more distant.
abstract: Massacre in Syria's government-held Tartus Province has made the prospect of stitching the country back together appear increasingly difficult as new depths of depravity by government forces inflames sectarian divisions;; footage routinely shows pro-government fighters beating, killing and mutilating Sunni rebel detainees, fueling pessimism about international efforts to end the fighting.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HANIA MOURTADA
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Sebnem Arsu from Antakya, Turkey.
